paper_abstract: For a subset S of positive integers let Omega(n, S) be the set of partitions of n into summands that are elements of S. For every lambda is an element of Omega (n, S), let M-n (lambda) be the number of parts, with multiplicity, that X has. Put a uniform probability distribution on Omega(n, S), and regard M-n as a random variable. In this paper the limiting density of the (suitably normalized) random variable M-n is determined for sets that are sufficiently regular. In particular, our results cover the case S = {Q(k) : k >= 1}, where Q(x) is a fixed polynomial of degree d >= 2. For specific choices of Q, the limiting density has appeared before in rather different contexts such as Kingman's coalescent, and processes associated with the maxima of Brownian bridge and Brownian meander processes. (c) 2007 Wiley Periodicals, Inc.
paper_title: Random partitions with restricted part sizes
